name: naively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you are too willing to believe that someone is telling the truth or that life is pleasant or fair: I naively believed he was telling the truth. I naively thought I wouldn't have to work too hard. See
naive
More examplesFewer examplesI had always rather naively assumed that the public were respectful towards nurses and doctors. I stupidly and naively forgot I was in front of a lot of cameras.I naively trusted someone who I thought was an honest friend.Naively, I turned up without a ticket, thinking it would be easy to get in.
